definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: The coco-cola frothed as it was poured out.
sentences.chinese: 可口可樂倒出來時泛起泡沫。

sentences.english: The beer frothed as it was poured out.
sentences.chinese: 啤酒倒出來時泛起泡沫。

sentences.english: Said the captain; his mood had changed again and the mirthless smile was back on his lips.
sentences.chinese: 他的情緒又變了，脣間又一次泛起了那陰沉的微笑。

sentences.english: The sea water foams under the bow.
sentences.chinese: 海水在船首下面泛起浪花。

sentences.english: The setting sun in dusk, rays and shoulders thrown in slightly fold.
sentences.chinese: 夕陽依着黃昏，霞光撒在肩頭泛起的微微褶皺。

sentences.english: A slight flush suffused her pale face, and she looked down, speaking to her hands.
sentences.chinese: 她蒼白的臉頰上泛起一抹紅暈，低下頭看着自己的手。

sentences.english: Clean and brilliant, deep plum red colour, with purple hues.
sentences.chinese: 酒液清澈明亮，深邃的梅紅色中泛起紫色光澤。

sentences.english: The tang of Scotch , sweat and gun-metal rose from his pages.
sentences.chinese: 他的書頁中泛起蘇格蘭的，汗水和炮銅的濃烈氣息。

sentences.english: The term "whitewater" refers to the appearance of the frothy water found in rapids.
sentences.chinese: “白浪”這個詞指的是急流泛起水沫的樣子。

sentences.english: The light of setting sun projects on the surface and start to be suffused with one in multiple layers thin ground gold color wave.
sentences.chinese: 夕陽的光投射在水面上，泛起一層層細碎的金色波浪。

sentences.english: Heart Lake, the little silver waves thrown up, difficult to calm.
sentences.chinese: 心湖中，點點銀波泛起，難以平靜。

sentences.english: Perfume from battle-fields rising, up from the foetor arising.
sentences.chinese: 醇香飄自這戰場，惡臭泛起沿着河上。

sentences.english: At this time, Wang Yaner eyes tears.
sentences.chinese: 此時的王燕兒眼睛裏也泛起淚光。

sentences.english: It would appear that Beatrice understood him. There came a deep flush to her cheek;
sentences.chinese: 比阿特麗絲顯然明白他言下之意，臉上泛起一股紅潮。

sentences.english: In the lonely lane there is no passer-by, the wind is up, the ripples are rampant in the river.
sentences.chinese: 孤寂的小路上空無一人，起風了，河裏泛起陣陣漣漪。

sentences.english: A crimson flush was glowing on her cheek, that had been long so pale.
sentences.chinese: 長期以來十分蒼白的面頰也泛起紅潮。

definition: to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
to float up/to rise to the surface/fig. to rise in the world
to flash through (one's mind)/to dodge (away from pursuers)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to appear before one's eyes/to come into view/to float into appearance/to come back (of images from the past)/to emerge/it emerges/it occurs (to me that..)
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
to raise one's head/to perk up
